title: Jiří Polívka
text: Jiří Polívka (born March 2, 1974 in <a href="Hradec%20Kr%C3%A1lov%C3%A9">Hradec Králové</a>) is a <a href="Czech%20Republic">Czech</a> <a href="Canoe%20racing">sprint canoer</a> who competed from the mid-1990s to the early 2000s (decade). At the <a href="1996%20Summer%20Olympics">1996 Summer Olympics</a> in <a href="Atlanta">Atlanta</a>, he was eliminated in the semifinals of the <a href="Canoeing%20at%20the%201996%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20K-2%20500%20metres">K-2 500 m</a> and <a href="Canoeing%20at%20the%201996%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20K-4%201000%20metres">K-4 1000 m</a> events. <a href="2000%20Summer%20Olympics">Four years later</a> in <a href="Sydney">Sydney</a>, Polívka was eliminated in the semifinals of the <a href="Canoeing%20at%20the%202000%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20K-4%201000%20metres">K-4 1000 m</a> event.
